title: Filipino American Psychology: A Handbook of Theory, Research, and Clinical Practice
author: Kevin L. Nadal
description: A comprehensive overview of the psychology and mental health issues of Filipino Americans. Nadal examines how Filipino American identity has been shaped by colonial history, immigration, and cultural values, and how these factors affect individualsâ€™ experiences (e.g. with family dynamics, racial microaggressions, or LGBTQ identities). The book presents research findings along with practical insights for counseling and community support. It also addresses the colonial mentality and other unique challenges faced by Filipino Americans, while offering strategies for empowerment and well-being in this populous Asian American subgroup.
